text:
'Becoming the hurricane', wrote Ranveer Singh on his Instagram, sharing a picture of him and Kapil Dev. It isn't a tough nut to crack that the Gully Boy actor is currently immersed completely in the upcoming project which is Kabir Khan's ambitious project on India's iconic world cup victory of 1983.
Titled 83, the film has gone on floors in Dharamshala and Ranveer Singh, along with other co-actors have begun their training session in Dharamshala. The actors are receiving training under the guidance of former Indian cricketers Balwinder Sandhu and Yashpal Sharma.
Instagram
While Ranveer Singh will be reprising the role of legendary cricketer Kapil Dev in the film, Saqib Saleem will be seen playing the role of Mohinder Amarnath and Tahir Bhasin will be seen as Sunil Gavaskar.
Just a few days ago, on Wednesday, Ranveer had shared a picture of himself with co-stars Saqib Saleem, Amy Virk, Hardy Sandhu, Jiiva, Addinath M Kothare, and Sahil Khattar among several others.
Don't Miss 185 SHARES 544 SHARES 411 SHARES 12.5 K SHARES 5.5 K SHARES
Instagram
Ranveer being Ranveer, his caption was as enthusiastic as his persona in real-life. He wrote,
"Kapil's devils descend on Dharamshala. It's on!"
Director Kabir Khan had shared the same picture with the caption, "Team '83 training at high altitude... Dharamshala."
Apart from training, Ranveer did take time out to meet and greet his fans who reached Dharamshala cricket stadium to catch a glimpse of him. The videos and pictures of Ranveer in Indian cricket jersey, interacting with his fans have been doing rounds on the internet.
🎥| Ranveer Singh greeting the fans at Dharamsala cricket ground ♥️
-
He is So CUTE 😂♥️♥️ pic.twitter.com/fPYiuHtXv0 — RanveerSingh TBT | #83🏏♥️ (@RanveerSinghtbt) April 4, 2019
The way Ranveer handles all the love and adulation of his fans just proves that he has his heart in the right place!
title: Ranveer Singh-Kapil Dev Take Over Dharamshala As Kabir Khan's 83 Goes On Floors!
description: 'Becoming the hurricane', wrote Ranveer Singh on his Instagram, sharing a picture of him and Kapil Dev. It isn't a tough nut to crack that the Gully Boy actor is currently immersed completely in the upcoming project which is Kabir Khan's ambitious project on India's iconic world cup victory of 1983.
